To the real property management, You guys found a great individual to be a part of your team. I was so grateful to have Mr. Nico come out today to help remove our old water tank heater.

Nico assessed the situation and immediately, devised a game plan and executed it in impeccable timing and efficiency. Nico was a one man army today and even repaired some of the work that was done on the initial visit. He took great care of us.

Make sure he gets a good raise 

Thank you again Nico!

Real Property Management North Puget Sound

google_reviews.author: Kayla T
google_reviews.review: RENTER BEWARE: Deceitful Property Management Company: 8/20/24 - RPM coerced me into signing a lease prior to viewing RPMs side of the move-in checklist. Thus, I didn't have a full understanding of the units' conditions. Furthermore, they exhibited deceitful business practices by telling me that I must sign the checklist and pay ALL FEES prior to receiving the keys. Upon arriving at the unit, it was found that the unit was left uncleaned (currently living in the last tenants filth), damaged beyond normal wear and tear, and exhibited signs of extreme water damage and black mold along with structural concerns. It seems that there's been no prevented maintenance for years. I am now concerned about my health and safety and, coupled with poor communication practices, has resulted in undostress and suffering for someone with medically evaluated disabilities like myself. Will continue to provide updates on the matter.

owner_response.text: We're truly sorry to hear about your experience, and we understand the importance of feeling safe and comfortable in your home. Please reach out to us via text or call so we can assist you further and address your concerns promptly.

Ive had such a great experience with Real Property Management North Puget Sound, and I have to give a special shout-out to Terry, the Maintenance Coordinator. Terry has been absolutely amazing! Whenever an issue arises, he handles it quickly and professionally, ensuring that everything is taken care of without any hassle. Its clear that Terry truly cares about the properties and the tenants, and his dedication shows in everything he does.
If I could give more than 5 stars, I would! Terrys hard work and commitment make a huge difference, and I feel confident knowing things are in great hands with him. Thank you, Terry, for consistently going above and beyond!

google_reviews.author: Ally Banks
google_reviews.review: We have had the pleasure of dealing with Terry throughout our rental agreement, she has been great! Always very timely on updates and maintenance requests. Real Property Management North Puget Sound has made the renting process seamless, I would definitely recommend them.

google_reviews.author: Clinton Leung
google_reviews.review:
I would not recommend renting from this property management company. If you must I would be ready to pay an excessive amount of fees and prepare for an unreasonable move out. To avoid being charged, I would highly recommend taking photos of absolutely everything, and even then RPM will still find something.

We left the place better than we found it, obliging with getting professional cleaners and carpet cleaners and yet RPM seems to nitpick on things that are just normal wear and tear. When attempting to contact them to come to a fair resolution they will placate you on the phone letting you know things will be ok or that they will call you back after confirming some things internally; this is all stalling - after a while they will just charge your security deposit and send you the invoice and then start dodging any attempts to call them.

If you are in this situation I would suggest being relentless with their phone lines until you get some actual confirmation in writing. DO NOT give them the benefit of the doubt or rely on their good faith. Get everything in writing very clearly and don't give up or stop calling them.

owner_response.text:
Clinton,
We are sorry you feel this way. Here at Real Property Management North Puget Sound, we make every effort to be honest and fair with the Tenants as well as the Owner of the property. If there is damage caused by the tenant that is beyond normal wear and tear, we are obligated to charge the tenant for that damage to make the Owner whole. For this reason, we take numerous photos at our very thorough pre-move in assessment.  We have no reason or incentive to be dishonest or unfair. Additionally, we resolved your problem with you and you said you'd remove the 1 star review.

google_reviews.author: Kathy Blaisdell
google_reviews.review: This is our third month of having RPM managing our apartment complex.  It is completely a day and night change of what we are used to having.  Response time is phenomenal, no longer two weeks to never, very happy with how things are handled.  Kept up to date on what is taking place at all times.  The staff is wonderful.   Terry has been awesome with always letting me know what is going on with my requests and how to be more efficient in the difference between maintenance and other items.   I am very happy with RPM.  I no longer feel I am talking to the wall.   Thank you RPM for all you do and I realize it will be a long process to complete everything, but it is nice to see the progress so far.   Kathy

owner_response.text: Thank you for your wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear about your positive experience with Real Property Management North Puget Sound. It's great to know that our response time and communication have made such a significant difference for you. We're especially glad that Terry and the team have been able to assist you effectively. Your satisfaction and peace of mind are our top priorities, and we're committed to continuing to provide excellent service. Thank you for your trust and support!

google_reviews.author: Colton Davis
google_reviews.review:
While Real Property Management might seem like a convenient choice for renting, my experience with them has been less than satisfactory.

Let me start with the move-out process, which was a nightmare. Expect to jump through hoops and incur unexpected expenses. Despite leaving the apartment in decent condition, I was hit with charges for what should be considered normal wear and tear. Nail holes in the wall, interior painting, and light bulb replacements were all on the list of things I was charged for. It felt like they were searching for any excuse to dip into my deposit. The most absurd part? Being forced to hire a professional cleaning company at my own expense.

Speaking of deposits, be prepared to say goodbye to a chunk of yours for a suspicious $200 admin fee. Apparently, coordinating move-out work that was supposedly my responsibility warranted this hefty deduction. And let's not forget the exorbitant charges for seemingly minor items. $284 for a freezer shelf? $77 for a gallon of paint? Absolutely ridiculous.

What's more, their strict subleasing policy is downright exploitative. Want to sublease? Sure, but only if you're willing to fork over three months' rent. It's a blatant cash grab and shows a complete lack of consideration for renters.

Overall, Real Property Management seems more interested in nickel and diming tenants than providing a fair and transparent renting experience. If I had known about their overly scrutinous move-out process beforehand, I would have meticulously documented every detail on the move-in inspection form. Consider yourself warnedrenters, beware.

owner_response.text:
We appreciate your feedback and take it seriously. At Real Property Management, we strive to provide a fair renting experience.
Regarding the move-out process, charges for items like excessive nail holes, tenant damage that requires painting, and burnt out light bulbs are outlined in the Lease Agreement, and are standard for maintaining the property's condition.
The admin fee for coordinating maintenance for tenant damage upon move-out is also standard and communicated upfront in the Lease Agreement.
Our subleasing policy is firm to ensure compliance with leasing regulations and protect both tenants and property owners.
We're sorry our processes didn't meet your expectations, though they were explained at lease signing and detailed in the lease. Thanks for your feedback and bringing your concerns to our attention.

google_reviews.author: Lindsey Price
google_reviews.review:
Future tenants should be aware that RPM puts their landlords above their tenants and are only interested in making money, not supporting the tenants. In a disagreement of the use of my security deposit, Gail was rude and unhelpful and because we couldnt agree, now I have to take an extra step and file a lawsuit just to get my deposit back. Gail repeatedly said the house was dirty to be rude rather than using any level of professionalism or customer service. She also offered no avenue to dispute the charge other than continuously saying this is how it must be instead of understanding its a mutual disagreement and we could use a mediator to resolve it. Why not clarify that its well within a tenant rights to dispute the charges? Im unsure if Gail is incapable or just unwilling to read the laws laid out to protect Washington state tenants.

I understand needing to leave the house in a certain condition based on our lease agreement but was being rude necessary? We are poor and we did our best, we couldnt afford the cleaners they wanted. We work full time and go to school full time, I couldnt spend more than a month deep cleaning the house to meet RPM needs. I recognize they want the house in a certain way and we didnt meet that standard but at this point and based on Gails attitude, I just feel totally scammed no matter what they say is wrong with the house because anything I say will just be met with this is how it must be done. In my opinion, forcing your tenants to perfect the home to your standard out of pocket is just taking advantage of renters who often dont have a choice about the fact they are renting.  Its unfortunate that RPM  doesnt do any work themselves and expects the previous tenant to perfect the house out of pocket for the next tenant, continuing to limit any work needed on RPM side and keeping them from having to bother investing in their properties and tenants.

I also find it extremely important to mention that we returned the house in the exact position it came in when we got it minus regular wear and tear from living in a 100+ year old house for 2 years. It was equally as dirty when we moved in, I spent 2 years deep scrubbing the dirty off of everything in the home (pictures below).

Some advice for RPM, maybe try caring about your tenants and properties by cleaning them yourself rather than being lazy and judgmental? Maybe also have a pre written email ready for tenant deposit disputes since you are not able to talk them through as a company in a nice and professional way. Regardless of their reasoning for taking some or all of my deposit, I just hope future tenants dont make the same mistakes I did and spend 2 months cleaning the house and scrubbing every inch to perfection and most importantly, have Gail walk through your house before you move out so its harder to get taken advantage of - otherwise they do the walkthrough alone and make their own decisions.

I also have a strong feeling based on their previous negative reviews that they will respond to this unprofessionally too. I dont care about the deposit or them, I just want other tenants to be protected and not make the same mistakes I did by renting through them.

owner_response.text:
We're sorry to hear about your experience. At Real Property Management, we prioritize professionalism and aim to provide excellent service to landlords and tenants alike. We strictly adhere to Tenant Landlord Law and take it seriously. Pet urine in carpet and along baseboards isn't considered normal wear and tear and must be addressed.

Regarding security deposit disputes, we follow Washington state laws and guidelines. We understand disagreements may arise and always aim for honesty and fairness to both tenants and owners.

Your feedback is important to us, and we're dedicated to improving our services. We apologize for any perceived rudeness, which doesn't reflect our customer service standards.

google_reviews.author: Ley Daffodil
google_reviews.review:
I cant say anything good about this property management. Moved into a very dirty (but surfaced cleaned, so couldnt tell until actually moving in), poorly taken care of home. Had many issues throughout the stay. Countless emails and complaints. Never were they taken care of. Had inspector come in every 6 months and would tell us every time that their notes and pictures were sent to property owner. And that most of the issues were ongoing before moving in. The stairs/porch/and back patio were unsafe and rotting.
I understand these are issues that the property owner should have taken care of. But with no help from the property management, we got no where to fix the issues.
Many times random employees would call or email to ask about lists of things needing to be done without investigating or checking with other employees who have already been made aware of issues. It was a constant cat and mouse game with this property management. It seemed like no one communicated within the office. And nothing was ever taken serious.
One night a pipe busted in our bathroom gushing hot water. For hours we couldn't get it to stop. We called the emergency line left a message. No one called back until the morning. Imagine if we didn't figure that out how high our bill would have been or how damaged the house could have gotten.
The fridge when we moved in was broken with missing drawers and shelves.
I don't know how property management could let this home get so bad and not do their due diligence with the owners to fix these terrible issues.

I've since moved out of state. But had I not, I would definitely steered clear of this management company again.

owner_response.text: We apologize for the experience you had with our property management. We understand your frustration with the cleanliness and maintenance issues you encountered during your stay. We strive to provide a well-maintained living environment for all our tenants and we apologize for falling short in this instance. google_reviews.author: Rick Tilton
google_reviews.review:
Exceptional Property Management Experience with Real Property Management North Puget Sound.

I recently had the pleasure of working with Frank Volkert and the team at Real Property Management North Puget Sound (RPMNPS) to handle the marketing, tenant screening, and overall management of my property. From our initial meeting to the successful one-year rental period, I couldn't be more satisfied with their services.

One of the standout aspects of RPMNPS is their commitment to ensuring the property is in optimal condition for attracting quality tenants. Frank Volkert, in particular, demonstrated a keen understanding of the market and provided valuable suggestions to enhance my property's appeal. His recommendations for painting and new floor coverings proved to be instrumental in attracting a pool of applicants.

The meticulous move-in inspection conducted by RPMNPS's home inspector set the tone for the professional standards upheld by the company. It was reassuring to know that they took the time to thoroughly assess the property before tenants moved in. Equally commendable was the follow-up inspection after six months, demonstrating their commitment to maintaining the property's condition over the long term.

Throughout the process, Frank displayed excellent communication and negotiation skills. From the moment the property was ready, he promptly presented a range of qualified applicants, allowing us to make an informed decision. This proactive approach ensured a seamless transition from property preparation to successful tenant placement.

I copied the name of the company to browser which sourced them out, I clicked on their website only to find the listing and many more houses listed for rent. That right there gave me a little hope as a start. I scheduled viewing for the next day and I must say RPM team over at Marysville WA, are all phenomenal. Things went too fast and in two weeks we are officially in our new rented place. All thanks to Rep Cynthia & Rose for helping to make the entire process worthwhile and smooth for us. Gods speed of blessings ladies. PS: I have referred two of our family friends for your service.

google_reviews.author: Suhas Manangi
google_reviews.review: Horrible company and horrible service. I signed up in Sept 2022, paid them 30% of rent in onboarding fees but they did not onboard tenants till late Oct, and didn't collect rent from one tenant for so long that led to eviction. Did the same with another tenant. Lost over 1 year of rents. They charged higher than market prices for placing tenants but below par services. Highly unresponsive management company. I terminated after one year for not meeting quality of service for which they sent a large retailiatory bogus bills. Unprofessional and stay away from them.

owner_response.text:
Suhas, we work very hard for our clients and did our very best in the situation you asked us to help you with.  This a description of what happened.           
Last year, when you first reached out to us about managing your 4-plex with existing tenants. We started management of units AB&D on 9/19/2022 and Unit C on 9/6/2022.  Unit A had 2 tenant's you had placed previously, that already were not paying you rent, we agreed to help you either get them to pay rent or get them to move on which we did. We got the tenants to vacate in Unit A on 11/30/22. They had trashed your rental so we facilitated a full renovation on Unit A to get it ready for the market by 12/27/2022 and got you new tenants for Unit A by 2/2/2023, this all during the slowest time of year for the rental market. Unit B was also a tenant you had placed before we started managing. She paid October 2022 rent, because of financial/emotional issues, she was not able to pay rent after that so we connected her with Volunteers of America and walked her through the process of applying for rental assistance. VoA assisted in helping her catch up with $5952.50 in rental assistance while she was paying what she could afford each month. However, she eventually stopped paying all-together and didn't apply for more assistance. She was evicted through legal process on 9/14/2023.  Unit 3 and 4 were also tenants you had found that we managed. They have been ideal tenants. Unit 3 & 4 have paid rent through the duration of our contract together. We worked diligently on the situation we were given and it's unfortunate that WA State Landlord Tenant Law mandates take longer than we all would have liked. Regarding the termination fees without proper notice as agreed to in the Management Contract. We discussed this with you and you wanted to terminate without proper notice regardless.

I have always been able to call with questions and get advice over the phone, email or even on site at the property.  We have always worked through any issue together.  For example, the staff in Everett helped me to make decisions about how to best remodel my first property to maximize the rent I could receive and to lower the amount of future repairs and maintenance requirements.  This is knowledge I've applied to other remodels and purchases.  Now that I'm up to a handful of properties, RPM has helped me as a partner the whole way.  They are a critical part of the team I count on in RE investing along with my bankers, RE mentor, legal and insurance.  Knowing RPM is in my corner has been key in having the confidence to keep looking for more investments.  Obviously, I highly recommend Real Property Management - North Puget Sound!

They WILL nickel and dime you for everything, as well as not review your move in statement when creating move out charges.

as someone whos been a property manager and been in the industry long term the operation is baffling and proves how money hungry these people are. There are many $200 nonsensical admin charges + many more issues.

owner_response.text: RPM follows all Washington State Tenant/Landlord laws. In all leases that we draft, a tenant agrees to return the property in the same condition it was given to them, minus normal wear and tear. We document in writing and with pictures the condition of the property before a tenant moves in and after a tenant moves out. We are sorry that we could not come to a happy resolution for you.

google_reviews.author: Jennifer B.
google_reviews.review:
When looking for a rental home in Snohomish County, I was very careful to evaluate rental management companies. I have heard horror stories and experienced one with my last rental property manager. So, when I found a house managed by RPM, I examined Real Property Management Puget Sound closely and found them to be professional, courteous, and timely in their responses. I decided that they were a property management company that I could work with.

Amy Hammer was our leasing agent and she was incredibly friendly and helpful. She walked us through the lease and the requirements before we signed.

On a scale of 1-5, I would give RPM a 4 (5 being stellar and no way to improve, 1 being "don't ever work with them"). The leasing process was smooth and Amy was available to answer any questions/concerns via email. She was very timely in her responses and addressed our concerns and questions well. We have had to put in a few maintenance requests and RPM was always prompt with addressing the requests. The problems we had were with the third party vendors who would often not return RPM's calls. But, that does not reflect on RPM.

Real Property Management exceeded my expectations as far as tenant privacy and autonomy. While there are quarterly walk-throughs, RPM is not overly demanding or intrusive as other property management companies can be.

One area to improve would be to communicate after a maintenance request has been completed. Two of our maintenance requests are still pending as (I assume, I haven't received communication about them) they are in the process of ordering replacement parts for a light fixture and a refrigerator. Followup emails as to what the plan is would be incredibly helpful.

Overall, I would not hesitate recommending RPM to someone looking to rent a home.

google_reviews.author: Em and Mom
google_reviews.review: From the initial application process to periodic questions and service requests, RPM has been a delight to work with. They are professional, friendly, and always punctual in getting back to us with regard to any requests that we might have.  I trust them as a renter and I would trust them with my property. I highly recommend them!

I guess she can do that on a whim. I was told to reach out for resolution.  There has been none.  I guess they manage the boarded up house?

yelp_reviews.author: Lindsey P.
yelp_reviews.review:
Future tenants should be aware that RPM puts their landlords above their tenants and are only interested in making money, not supporting the tenants. In a disagreement of the use of my security deposit, Gail was rude and unhelpful and because we couldn't agree, now I have to take an extra step and file a lawsuit just to get my deposit back. Gail repeatedly said the house was 'dirty' to be rude rather than using any level of professionalism or customer service. She also offered no avenue to dispute the charge other than continuously saying 'this is how it must be' instead of understanding it's a mutual disagreement and we could use a mediator to resolve it. Why not clarify that it's well within a tenant rights to dispute the charges? I'm unsure if Gail is incapable or just unwilling to read the laws laid out to protect Washington state tenants.

I understand needing to leave the house in a certain condition based on our lease agreement but was being rude necessary? We are poor and we did our best, we couldn't afford the cleaners they wanted. We work full time and go to school full time, I couldn't spend more than a month deep cleaning the house to meet RPM needs. I recognize they want the house in a certain way and we didn't meet that standard but at this point and based on Gail's attitude, I just feel totally scammed no matter what they say is wrong with the house because anything I say will just be met with 'this is how it must be done'. In my opinion, forcing your tenants to perfect the home to your standard out of pocket is just taking advantage of renters who often don't have a choice about the fact they are renting. It's unfortunate that RPM doesn't do any work themselves and expects the previous tenant to perfect the house out of pocket for the next tenant, continuing to limit any work needed on RPM side and keeping them from having to bother investing in their properties and tenants.

I also find it extremely important to mention that we returned the house in the exact position it came in when we got it minus regular wear and tear from living in a 100+ year old house for 2 years. It was equally as 'dirty' when we moved in, I spent 2 years deep scrubbing the dirty off of everything in the home (pictures below).

Some advice for RPM, maybe try caring about your tenants and properties by cleaning them yourself rather than being lazy and judgmental? Maybe also have a pre written email ready for tenant deposit disputes since you are not able to talk them through as a company in a nice and professional way. Regardless of their reasoning for taking some or all of my deposit, I just hope future tenants don't make the same mistakes I did and spend 2 months cleaning the house and scrubbing every inch to perfection and most importantly, have Gail walk through your house before you move out so it's harder to get taken advantage of - otherwise they do the walkthrough alone and make their own decisions

yelp_reviews.author: Rinay R.
yelp_reviews.review: They completely charged us every single penny of our deposit for owners responsible repairs. Water leaking into our light fixtures, toilet running from day 2 of move in and noted, windows leading from faulty installation, foundation cracks that had ants building calanies threw them.......DONT RENT FROM THEM EVERRRRRRRRR

yelp_reviews.author: Bain M.
yelp_reviews.review:
RPM has managed my property since 2018 and have provided excellent service and support.  Communication is quick and requests are fulfilled in a reasonable amount of time.  The maintenance reviews are thorough with a the focus on priorities.  Payments are prompt and on time as well as the 1099 tax form every year.

I support and recommend RPM for anyone considering a property management company for their rental property.

yelp_reviews.author: Sean D.
yelp_reviews.review:
I would highly recommend using SOMEONE ELSE to rent out your home. Over the course of a little under four months they dropped the ball on numerous minor maintenance issues and exhibited poor communication throughout that period. Ultimately they decided they couldn't handle our reasonable requests and, tired of being called out on their poor performance, dropped us (a true blessing). Below are numerous examples of why you should use SOMEONE ELSE to rent out your house. 
- Right off the bat they didn't advertise  our house correctly, completely leaving out the central air conditioning (something not every house has in the PNW) and mislabeled the square footage. Our tenants were not told about the air conditioning either until a neighbor casually mentioned it in conversation in the dead of summer.  We were also told we'd be informed of all applicants before signing. After many phone calls we were told a week after someone had already signed a lease. 
- Miscommunication by the maintenance department. We had told them before signing We'd like a break down of all expenses for maintenance, which they said they'd provide us.  Once we signed with RPM they immediately went against their word and would not give us any form of billing breakdown.  
- Second issue with maintenance department. Told them our furnace had been serviced June 2018. While performing maintenance on the property in April 2019 they asked if we wanted it serviced. We told her that if the maintenance man on the property would be able to check furnace at same time that would be fine so that we didn't have to pay to send him out again in 2 months. He couldn't so RPM sent a separate maintenance person out (zero notification to us) and we received an early surprise bill. 
- Third issue with maintenance department. They sent a plumber out to fix a toilet issue twice on the same toilet (we would later find out). After calling Sarah (maintenance manager) multiple times over a 2 week period to get a straight answer we were told the plumber claimed it was a different toilet the second visit.  We were able to fix it for $15 after paying over $200 to a plumber they work with. 
- Called to ask about the annual inspection coming up due to our growing concerns with tasks being forgotten with the property. We were told by Sarah that we'd be cc'd in an email in regards to scheduling it. After one week we still had not received an email. We were about to follow up again when we were contacted  saying the inspection had been already been done. The inspection and photos were supposed to be of the whole house, but what we received were only two out of three floors, completely missing the full basement (which includes a bedroom, walk in closet, and full bathroom), and our garage. When questioned about it I was told they'd be sent back without additional charge. Surprise, they never came.
- Fourth issue with the maintenance department. I was told by Erin and Frank before signing that any maintenance expense would be cleared with me and that we would not be in contact with the tenant. The property company is supposed to be our middle man. After the annual inspection we had a few repairs including a front porch step. We had called Sarah in the maintenance department and told her we would hire someone to come out so they could inform the tenant. They then told us they don't inform the tenant if they don't hire the maintenance man. We spoke with Gail (office manager) since we were told we couldn't contact the tenant and were told that most owners just let them take care of everything and don't worry as much. Our home is important to us and too expensive to not care about these expenses, especially since RPM had developed a pattern of dropping the ball on basic things in only a three month period.
- After having months of back to back issues we requested to please speak to Frank or Daniel (father/son owners of the company) to ease our mind. Upon asking for clarification or an apology so we can move forward we received an email stating it was best to part ways. In this email it stated that they would mail all documents, security deposit, and keys for the property within 30 days. They screwed this up too. We never received keys for our property with the documents and security deposit within those 30 days and after waiting until mid September we contacted RPM about the keys. They told us at first they should of been mailed (they hadn't). We asked if they'd please check so we we know if we we need to rekey the home right away. The receptionist found them and offered to mail them to us and we finally got them nearly four weeks after we were told they'd arrive. 
- RPM told us our tenants were a family of five, which we learned was untrue and they were really a family of seven. The number of family members isn't a big deal but a rental company should be able to give a clear and truthful answer to a question like that.

owner_response.text:
Sean, 
  I am sorry about the bad experiences you had. I will look into the issues you brought up and do some correcting on our end as needed. 
  It is our policy to communicate with our Clients quickly, address issues and resolve them. I am surprised I didn't know about these issues when you were having them. Some of the items you spoke about, we have corrected.
  If there is anything we still need to resolve please let me know.
Frank Volkert

yelp_reviews.author: Chelsea O.
yelp_reviews.review: If I could give this place 0 stars I would but sadly that's not an option. We moved into our townhouse leased by RPM in February 2020 right before the Covid lockdown. Two weeks into moving in a pipe burst in our ceiling above the kitchen. It took 9 months to fix it YALL 9 MONTHS. Not to mention anytime we have put it in a request for maintenance no one responds for months or even reaches out to check on us. SHAMS AND SCAMS. We have paid every month on Time through out a global pandemic and I can't even get a text back. The most recent event that took place happened today which led to me writing this review. Our lease is renewing at the first of August. One of our room mates communicated to our landlord and RPM at the beginning on July that she would be moving and that a new room mate would be moving in. RPM said nothing and our landlord gave th go ahead. Now we have 3 days until the new lease is due for renewal and they STILL haven't taken our old room mate off and new room mate on. Now they are saying our new room mate has to apply and pay $100 to be added to the lease -excuse me WHAT. The lady named Sue we talked to today was incredibly rude and condescending to our new room mate she even MADE FUN OF HER LAST NAME. Like was laughing at it. It was disgusting. They are human trash bags and Im not one to leave a 1 star review but this is OBSCENE. Run for the hills if this is your property management company on a place you are looking at renting.

owner_response.text:
I am sorry that you had a bad experience and I believe there could have been some miscommunication. RPM always tries to follow Tenant/Landlord laws. I am sorry this is getting back to you late. Please feel free to call us and ask for John so we can see if we can come up with a resolution.
Thanks

yelp_reviews.author: Lucas P.
yelp_reviews.review: My wife and I recently moved back to the area and we're on a definite time crunch to get a place.. I originally spoke with John and he was super polite and helpful and kept us updated daily. Rose then helped us out on our lease agreement and Gail took over for her as Rose was on vacation the following week. They even stayed late for us to sign paperwork as we had driven 12 hours and were a little behind. All in all everyone was pleasant to deal with and very friendly. We got into an amazing rental and we are definitely happy! Thank you to the amazing employees and great customer service!

yelp_reviews.author: Linnea E.
yelp_reviews.review:
Christa @ RPM or Real Property Management located in Everett, WA is first class!

I called today with questions because my husband and I are considering
investing in a rental property in the North part of Everett...we are more interested in the area west of Broadway.

We own rentals in other areas but are not familiar with north Everett. But we heard it is a growing area and could be a good investment. We wanted to know what kind of rent a small, 1000' rental might bring in a specific area from the point of view from a property management firm?

Christa, Executive Assistant was incredible! She not only assisted with with my original question providing approximate rental incomes. 

Her knowledge of the area, her explanation of her company's services was the most thorough of the several other property management companies I spoke with. She was able to assist me much better than anyone else even though I was not asking them to manage a property for them...

Christa understood that someone in a preliminary search to purchase a rental is just as important to serve as a homeowner searching for the right property management company.

She told me of the growing area, about the two hospitals nearby, also a new WSU campus soon to be built and that the closer one gets to the water the higher the property values are.

Christa was able to inform me of the process by which they utilize for billing homeowners for any repairs per month, when rents were due (3 day grace period for tenants) and when homeowners were transferred their monthly rent due. She described their program enabling all billings to be available to the homeowner online and emphasized how simplistic and easy it was to understand.

She described surrounding areas such as Mukilteo, their great school district and how many tenants enjoy living in the Mukilteo vicinity...

Christa provided me with much more than just potential rent info. She is a terrific representative for this company, Real Property Managagement.
We are so appreciative of her patience, knowledge and willingness to go outside of the box to help us.  

Bottom line, if we require services of a Property Management Co I will call Christa because I know she would get the job done and get it done right.

Please thank her for me.

yelp_reviews.author: Ryan S.
yelp_reviews.review:
So if I can give less then a one I would. We rented our house out and these guys were the property manage company that we hired. They not only did not supervise the renters but let the renters do modifications to our home with out our consent. Then when we moved back the damages to our home were not fixed and when they did send our their so called maintenance guy he was rude and started to curse my wife and me and then treat us poorly in our own home. The owners are not the people they portray to be and they are not helpful at all. My Advise to all potential homeowners, do not rent your home thru these guys. I will continue to spread the word on all social media so that everyone can know what they are and how they treat the homeowners. BEWARE


I will continue to advice the public on how they treat people and what the company is about!!!!



Reply to Frank.

Once again full of lies from Frank the owner, we do not drink any alcohol because if religious convictions. So right there is a bold face lie from the so called owner Frank. It took you 4 months to actually respond to this post. You still have not called us! Your maintenance person who you say is so friendly and non aggressive was cursing a woman out! This does not sound like a nice maintenance person. Your employee is a coward for fighting with a woman and your team did not check on the tenants like they should have. You should have caught that they were making modifications to the house like building shelves. 

Once again your company and your team is not who you say they are. Most of your reviews on yelp are people you know. It's fake. Just like how you think you represent your company!  By the way the so called police report is also BS when your employee is on my property threatening and cursing us!

owner_response.text:
Ryan,
I am sorry you feel this way. We did do all we could to accommodate you and your wife including allowing you to move in the day the tenant moved out because of some extreme difficulties you and your wife had endured. If we came across unprofessionally in any way, my sincerest apologies.
  We did all we could to honor your requests and still abide by Landlord Tenant Laws to protect you.
Under normal circumstances, we would have repaired any tenant damage while the home was not occupied, because you seemed to be distraught about moving immediately in, we were compassionate, allowed you to move in before we could assess and repair any tenant damage we agreed with you to do any repairs while you were in the home. When our maintenance person arrived to do the pre-arranged repairs, he could smell alcohol and was met by so much hostility that he felt he needed to file a police report after the incident. He is a very kind person and was extremely bothered by the way he was treated and is in no way an aggressive person. 
 We always are professional and only want the best and what's right for our Owners and Tenants for everyone's protection.
I am sorry for the difficulties your family have endured. I hope the best for you and your family.

yelp_reviews.author: Kathleen W.
yelp_reviews.review: We have worked with RPMNPS for 2 years now on multiple properties.. The service has been exceptional. Each member is knowledgeable, professional and a pleasure to work with. They are always responsive to us and to our tenants when needed and we always feel our properties are being well managed and that our tenants are being looked after as well. We highly recommend them.

yelp_reviews.author: Peabody J.
yelp_reviews.review:
Looked at a property that they were renting. We asked if people already had interested parties as we did not want to pay $100 and have credit dinged for nothing. 
We were told there were two people who had an application in but not all of their info (pay stubs and what not) and that if we got everything in first we move to the top. 

So we went home and paid the $100 and gave all the info they wanted. We were called right away and said looks good and that we would know the next day. 

Later that day I got an email saying someone else that had all their stuff in put down a deposit and so they got the place. 

So I feel like we were scammed.

yelp_reviews.author: Ron R.
yelp_reviews.review:
Is terrible. Warning do not let them tell you they do not have to be there on final walk through. Once your out they will say there is damage you are responsible for and not return your deposit. Left the place better than we received it.

R

yelp_reviews.author: Sean W.
yelp_reviews.review:
Del has been amazing.  We are moving from California bringing three dogs and with my entire family.  Del was amazing through it all.  Step by step Del was there for me to assist me and still looking our for the home owner of the rental we were looking at. I can not thank Del enough for the hard work and determination.  Del took so much stress out of this move from state to state I could not be any happier or grateful.

I highly recommend Real Property Management North Puget Sound, 

My family is forever grateful for Del.

yelp_reviews.author: Robley K.
yelp_reviews.review:
GAY COUPLES BEWARE

We are a gay couple who recently went through the process of renting a condominium with Real Property Management of North Puget Sound. We were kept running in circles, dealing with a succession of employees to satisfy their application process. We are property owners in the process of relocating and are immensely qualified with excellent credit. 

As we were kept waiting, they rented the property to others. Maybe they can technically defend their actions as mere confusion or incompetence, but I hope they never try this again with a gay couple. We will let the Washington State Human Rights Commission, the BBB, and their franchisers look into this issue and find out just what is happening, and to see if a pattern of discrimination emerges.

yelp_reviews.author: Eric B.
yelp_reviews.review:
After buying a new home in Q3 of 2013 I decided to try turning my previous home into a rental. I spoke with three different property management companies in detail and a few others over the telephone and email. In the end I choose RPM. I choose RPM for three reasons. First, of all the companies I spoke with RPM was the best communicator. They always got back to me fast and give me the information I needed. Second, RPM offered the best value for their management fee. Third, the real estate agent I had been working with for over a year, to find my new home, had worked with Frank at RPM and recommended them. My adventure with rental property is just beginning, but, I feel confident everything is going to work out well with RPM as my partner.

Update: March 2014
RPM found a tenant for my home a couple of months ago and everything has been going great. The whole RPM team has been very helpful.

yelp_reviews.author: Ryan M.
yelp_reviews.review: Experience has not been as good.  Frank quoted me $800 for painting my condo, and he ending up charging me $1200.  He didn't call me about it either, I found our when he sent the bill.

yelp_reviews.author: Mystery R.
yelp_reviews.review: Excellent Team.  Everything is new to me, first time to rent my house - they are patient with me to get everything in order and succeed.

yelp_reviews.author: Mehedi Hussain P.
yelp_reviews.review: Emily scheduled an appointment to show a property. I was there and tried to get a hold of her. Calling number was turned off and was going to her voicemail. After 2 days i was checking again with her on email and figured out its already rented. What a waste of time! Terrible service.

owner_response.text:
Mehedi,
  Our apologies for your experience. In today's rental market, anyone who wants to rent must be persistent. We really work hard to get our rentals leased to great qualified tenants as quickly as possible.
Frank Volkert

yelp_reviews.author: Nathaniel W.
yelp_reviews.review: RPM has done an excellent job being prompt, accommodating, and getting the job done on multiple occasions, but I want to give a special shout out to Frank, who came out at an inconvenient time to solve a baffling problem. For about a week we had been experiencing the dreaded beep of a fire alarm unit, the only thing is that through several battery changes the beeping wouldn't go away, and the source couldn't be found. This was a serious disruption to our sleep, especially to my wife who has been recovering from surgery and desperately needed the sleep. I explained this all to Frank over the phone and he went out his way to come out and investigate for himself. After some head-scratching, trial-and-error, and sound detection, the source was found, we were able to deactivate it and sleep soundly. I really appreciate RPM and Frank's dedication to protect our quality of living and I'd gladly recommend them to anyone considering a property!

yelp_reviews.author: Casey W.
yelp_reviews.review:
I've been a landlord and a tenant.  If you're a landlord - this company is solid.  If you're a tenant - I'd stay away from properties managed by this company.  I'll try to keep this short, despite having a lot to say.  To be transparent, I'm writing this review as a tenant, since that was my interaction with RPM.
Move-in and the checklist took over an hour and a half!  Longest I've experienced as a tenant.  I called their emergency line because there was water under the fridge that continued to appear after wiping it up.  It took them 2 days to get back to me.  Other than that, all was good during our short (3-4 month) lease.  The real headaches came when it was time to terminate our lease early - we paid the steep early termination penalty (which I don't have a problem with, it was a part of the contract and I'm a reasonable person).  They advised when we moved in that we would have to use "one of (their) approved vendors" for both the move-out cleaning and carpet cleaning.  This is where the biggest frustration with RPM lays - RPM only had a single vendor for both.  I had no choice at all for who we used.  See my separate review of the cleaning company, Morgan Real Estate Management.  I was at the mercy of those vendors for what they wanted to charge for their services.  
I understand that RPM is working to protect the owner of the rental property.  However, from a tenant perspective, you're going to pay on the backend of your rental.  Personally, I'd stay away from them as a tenant in the future - they aren't reasonable when it comes to services at move-out.

yelp_reviews.author: Jesse R.
yelp_reviews.review:
Frank and his family are the owners of RPM in Everett, which covers north of Seattle. They do a great job of setting the correct expectation with the owners they work with and they are the liaison between the owner and the renter so you don't have to bring emotion into your renting experience as an owner. Frank does a great job of keeping Up to date with property values and what your maximum potential can be in different areas of the market.

As a networking partner of Frank's, I get to better understand more about his business and the way he handles his customers, and the level of integrity that he has for this type of business is outstanding.  

I am honored to refer my friends and family to him for any of their rental needs.

A+ for Customer Service and Integrity

yelp_reviews.author: Dale B.
yelp_reviews.review: We had a great experience working with Frank and Real Property Management. Frank was able to work and communicate with me effectively, especially with me being out of state. I really appreciate all of the informative data he provided me to make an informed decision on when it came to my rental.  It did not take long for Frank and his team to find a quality renter for my property.  I would definitely recommend Real Property Management!

yelp_reviews.author: Claudette C.
yelp_reviews.review: I have several properties in several different states (Navy) and I have had several different property managers throughout the years and Real Property Management has been the best out of all of the PMs that we have had.  There are more fees than a traditional PM, but they have a lot of guarantees and I can tell you from past rental experience you want the PM that checks on your house every 6 months.  They have a guy Jeff that sends out detailed reports on the 6 month walk throughs with pictures so you can see how your property looks.  Additionally, when I call or have a concern, the staff take my concerns seriously which is important to me because I have had other PMs who acted like me renting was just a hobby and they woudn't email or call me back.  I wish all of my PMs were as detail oriented as RPM.  I feel relieved that we found a company that treats my property with as much respect as I do.

yelp_reviews.author: Letizia A.
yelp_reviews.review:
Frank and the RPM team are phenomenal! 
They are very responsive and take initiative to reach out to us ahead of time when leases are coming due, when repairs need to be made, or just to make sure we are aligned on the overall plan for our properties. They get back to me quickly when I email or call, so I never have to call twice or remind them of anything. They've even helped me get multiple bids for landscaping and completely remodeling one of my properties. Frank has also advised me regarding potential rents and driven by to check out properties ahead of me buying them. RPM has truly been an essential partner in our real estate adventures, and I trust that they will take care of our properties like their own.

I wish all of my properties were in a location that Frank and the team could manage them!

yelp_reviews.author: Eric V.
yelp_reviews.review:
Updated Review (09/29/2018):
After being rental owners from 2014-2018, we finally sold our house this month.  During the entire time we rented it out, RPM was our partner in every way, walking us through the process of being a rental owner, handling the stress of managing the property, and ensuring that we had quality renters each and every time.  When it came time to pass the baton to someone else and sell our home, RPM worked closely through the transition process, even serving as our go-between with the utility company after the last renters moved out so that the process could move forward (we live in another state now, making dealing with the utility company difficult)!  They also referred us to a good real estate agent.  I wish we could have sold the property sooner (e.g. May / June) and gotten a better return, but we are still extremely happy with RPM of North Puget Sound.  The entire team has our complete endorsement, without reservation!

- - - - - -

Previous Review (5/29/2015):
My family and I had to move after I was laid off and needed to relocate across the country.  We wanted to set up our home in WA as a rental, so we researched rental management agencies for some time to locate the right one.  

After significant investigation, we determined that Real Property Management of North Puget Sound (RPM) would be the best fit for us, due to their professionalism, care, and concern for their customers.

We have not been disappointed at any time, and in fact our expectations were met and exceeded when a minor snafu with a changed bank account and a misplaced payment was rectified over the weekend by Frank and his team.

Amazing service and dedication - we cannot recommend them highly enough.

yelp_reviews.author: Chelsea H.
yelp_reviews.review: We can't say enough great things about Del. She was absolutely the most supportive, helpful agent that we could ever hope for. We are a young family and were looking to move closer to our jobs and out if comfort zones so we had a lot of questions and a lot of back and forth moments. She never once made us feel bad or rushed for asking them. She was available night and day via e-mail and phone. When we did the pre move in inspection she really played on our side in documentation, she understands what it can be like renting right now. Again, we could not be happier wih our new home and with Del.

yelp_reviews.author: Erica O.
yelp_reviews.review: I'd have to say that being in the place I have been for as little as we have been, it's not bad. Especially since it was hectic enough moving across the US. Amy was great and prompt. Didn't really mislead us in anyway. If I could rate the landlord, it would be a different story however, but this is about RPM more than anything. Are landlord doesn't do a very good job at communication nor do our things that were not fixed before we moved in have any clue when they are going to be fixed now. But the staff at Rpm is very friendly and kind and prompt in getting back with us even when it is not their place to. Our landlord is responsible for all repairs but they kindly send their service man out to fix our washer when it was not their job to and that I am grateful for. It was painless and easy to move in and I made sure that we had everything that we needed including who to contact and contact numbers for electric and what not. Amy was great as well! So for the service from the staff at Rpm five thumbs up if that's possible:-)

yelp_reviews.author: Krysten D.
yelp_reviews.review: Amy is awesome! My husband and I were in search of homes during the Christmas holiday, so we were finding it tough to get much response from other property management companies. After much searching, my husband and I finally found a beautiful property for rent through RPM's website. From the time we viewed the property, to submitting our applications and signing the lease, Amy has been nothing but responsive, professional and friendly. The entire move-in process was very seamless and Amy patiently answered all of our questions. It's tough to find a good property management company who is responsive. Thank you, Amy and RPM!

yelp_reviews.author: Elaina H.
yelp_reviews.review: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! They not only take forever to respond and address your issues and problems with the home your renting, but they also charge you fees they are not entitled to and take money without notifying you out of your security deposit once you move out and refuse to answer you on the matter. They do not abide by the law, you have to fight them on the tenant and landlord law for them to "get things going", and even when you have proof, they are still passive aggressive. They do not allow you to be present at the walk thru after you move out, which allows them to come up with whatever they want to come up with. They require you to use their carpet cleaning company, you're not allowed to use any other company. You have to use their cleaning companies and even if you have a quote and receipt of the service in hand, they add additional fees on top of that without notifying you.  If you call for service like you would any other rental, ie. fridge isn't working, dishwasher broke, no hot water etc., they will charge you at the end of your lease without ever telling you about it and then just arbitrarily come up with a figure and deduct that out of your security deposit when it is their responsibility to take care of these items. If you want a reliable, honest company to rent from, RPM North Puget Sound is NOT the place to go.

owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. You are however contractually obligated to all the deductions made from your deposit. The total amount deducted did not reach $500.00. Separately, please note that you did not pay all of your utilities upon vacating like you had told us you would in early May of this year. That balance remains outstanding. We are happy to discuss this further and please contact us.  Thank you.

yelp_reviews.author: Jessica H.
yelp_reviews.review: If I could give this company 0 stars I would. Do not rent through them, especially if you are military! The only reason we stayed in our rental for 2 years was because we loved the house and our neighbors. And the home owner was also military and we didn't want to screw her over by leaving. But, these people were a nightmare to deal with. We moved in and like with any rental company we were give x amount of days to add issues to the walk through list and document things that needed to be fixed. But, when we emailed them we never got a reply. Emailed again no reply. Any time we needed something to be fixed it took weeks or more to hear back from someone. But you better believe the one time there was an issue with our bank they were blowing up my phone! The staff is rude and unprofessional and the owners refuse to email back as well. Last June the refrigerator started leaking and caused black mold (which I'm severely allergic to) and it took over a month for their "maintenance" guy to come look at it, and then when he swore it was fixed a few days later it was leaking again. We called the company no response, emailed no reply. Fast forward a few months and my husband received new military orders and these idiots refused to let us out of our lease even with OFFICIAL MILITARY ORDERS! This company is a joke and I will be sure that all of our military friends and family knows not to rent through RPM. Don't pride yourself on helping our military members and their families then treat them like crap!

owner_response.text:
I am sorry you feel like this way. When the tenant returns possession of the property to the Landlord, it needs to be clean and returned in as good condition as when rented (normal wear and tear excepted). If it is not returned in good condition, we and you the tenant, are under contract to have it cleaned and repaired for the owner using the security deposit.
We always comply with the laws regarding our service members. Please note: "Discharge" from Military service does not apply under the Service Member Civil Relief Act 535 section (B) par (1) (b), nor is it sufficient under RCW 59.18.200 to release a tenant from their lease obligation. Even still, the Owner of the property, being Military themselves, allowed you to break your lease without penalty. Repairs still needed to be done.
We do have high regard for Military personnel. We have a veteran employed here. We have seldom had any issues from Property Owners or Tenants who are Military. Thank you for your service to our country.

yelp_reviews.author: bub b.
yelp_reviews.review: For the first time in 8 yrs, my husband and I found ourselves looking for a home to rent. A lot has changed in the rental industry and it was a bit overwhelming looking at places and having so many different policies and fees attached to just renting a home. When we contacted RPM, we spoke with Emily and she was so nice and eager to answer all our questions. She went out of her busy schedule to arrange a time for us to see our new home. We are very happy we worked with RPM and are very happy in our new place.

yelp_reviews.author: Robert J.
yelp_reviews.review: If you need a property manager that knows the industry and have not met with Frank yet, immediately after you read this you must stop whatever you are doing and contact him. He genuinely cares for his clients and always does what is in their best interest. I can't recall ever meeting a more compassionate caring person. As a contractor who has worked for several property management companies, there is only one I recommend, and it couldn't be any stronger. Give him a call and you will know what I'm talking about.

yelp_reviews.author: Scott S.
yelp_reviews.review: Del provided thorough responses to all of my questions, had great follow up (even after I took occupation of my new residence), and they did a thorough inspection of the unit including photo evidence of any flaws that existed before I moved in. I would very highly recommend using Real Property Management North Puget Sound to anyone looking to rent in the North end.

yelp_reviews.author: Mara L.
yelp_reviews.review: I had been managing my rental home myself from another state.  With Washington rental laws set up to favor the tenant, it was becoming increasingly difficult to stay in compliance as well as  feel my property was being cared for.  I manage vacation rental properties in Colorado and most of the time really enjoy it, so giving up management of the house in Edmonds was not easy for me to do.  I called several agencies and Daniel  V. was the one answering the phone, ( not a machine) so I was able to feel a personal touch right off the bat.   Daniel has been personable and conscientious throughout the term of what is now the second lease.  Although the costs of management companies in the metro Seattle area are higher than they are in many places, I like working with a family business who I have found to be trustworthy. At times I have felt like Real Property leaned over backwards to please the tenants, without much regard for how I as the owner felt or saw it.  But they have found good matches for my house, the rent has always come in and renters have taken good care of the  house.  I have suggested them to others and will continue to.  I did not give them 5 stars because for me the best of the best in  management companies would be one that has several management plans to select from, e.g. just marketing and placement or just overseeing once a tenant is placed etc.  I did find a few who do this, but I stayed with Real Property because I had begun a working relationship with them and I trust them.

summary.text:
Good

Real Property Management North Puget Sound has demonstrated consistent efficiency in resolving maintenance issues and providing excellent customer service. Many tenants have praised the company for quick responses to their inquiries. A tenant highlighted that dealing with maintenance was made easy and stress-free thanks to the diligence and prompt assistance of the maintenance team, particularly singling out a maintenance coordinator for his excellent service.

Additionally, the company's commitment to careful communication and management has been appreciated. It is evident from user reviews that the staff handles various tenancy issues professionally, ensuring that tenants are well-informed about any changes or updates regarding their rental agreements. This level of customer service and proactive problem-solving is a testament to their dedication to maintaining tenant satisfaction.

Great

Real Property Management North Puget Sound is frequently commended for its dedicated staff, who go above and beyond in their service delivery. Clients have mentioned that the company has far exceeded their expectations by providing thorough walk-throughs and regular updates, ensuring everything is in order and handled diligently. Users have appreciated how certain employees remain professional, courteous, and responsive, making the leasing and maintenance processes seamless.

For property owners, the peace of mind offered by RPM's management services is invaluable. One landlord shared satisfaction with RPM’s ability to attract and retain quality tenants, reducing tenant turnover. The company’s effective marketing strategies, comprehensive inspections, and tenant relations significantly contribute to a positive ownership experience. Recommendations for RPM are often enthusiastic, with clients confident in their capabilities and proven track record.

Bad

Despite the numerous positive experiences shared, some reviews indicate areas where Real Property Management North Puget Sound could improve. A few tenants have expressed frustration with the company's deposit return process. Claims of unexpected fees and dissatisfaction with RPM's handling during the move-out process are mentioned, suggesting a need for increased clarity and communication regarding lease agreements and expectations.

Issues around delayed maintenance responses have also been highlighted. Some reviews noted that emergency maintenance requests, such as plumbing issues, were not addressed as promptly as expected, leading to dissatisfaction and inconvenience for residents. Improved protocol on urgent repair responses could enhance the renter experience, addressing concerns about efficiency in resolving critical issues.

Ugly

Several user reviews represent a stark contrast to the generally positive feedback, highlighting substantial dissatisfaction with Real Property Management North Puget Sound. Tenants have flagged issues related to unfair treatment during move-outs, including claims of wrongful charges against security deposits for damages considered normal wear and tear.

The most severe criticisms are directed at the company's communication and problem resolution processes. Some former tenants have described experiences of negligence regarding maintenance requests, leading to safety concerns and considerable stress. A former tenant noted experiences of being misled and a lack of accountability and transparency during critical moments, such as illegal eviction proceedings, damaging trust and raising questions about the management's integrity.
